channel.title: Sauce Labs Open Source
channel.description: Recent content on Sauce Labs Open Source

item.title: Visualize HAR Files With The New React Network Viewer Component
item.description: A HAR file contains requests tracking information between a web browser and a website.

item.title: SeleniumConf Virtual 2020 Recap
item.description: This year the Selenium Conference was held virtually, and despite that, the conference was again that exciting place where the Selenium community meets every year to share and learn about the most popular browser automation tool in the world.

item.title: How to delete your master branch
item.description: At the Selenium project we practice trunk based development, in which trunk is the usual name of the default git branch of the repository.

item.title: How Open Source Can Drive Product Obsession
item.description: Nearly every start-up company goes through the same experience - the founders will start with a vision or idea that pivots over time as the product (hopefully) finds its market fit and is modified and adapted to the needs and requests of end users.

item.title: Intro: Sauce Labs Open Source Program Office
item.description: Photo by Markus Winkler (Unsplash) Not long ago, we announced that we created our Open Source Program Office to deepen our investment in the broader open source community.

item.title: Oops, you are offline.
item.description: You should try to find some internet connection to browse here.

item.title: Approval Guide for Managers
item.description: As a manager at Sauce Labs, your direct reports will ask from time to time if they can make an internal codebase an open source project.

item.title: Contributing to Open Source
item.description: Participation in open source projects is highly encouraged, and the Open Source Program Office wants to make this process as simple as possible.

item.title: Open Source Licensing Guide
item.description: Here you will find a list of policies and guidance concerning which licenses can be used at Sauce Labs, both internally and in open source projects hosted under a Sauce Labs managed GitHub organization.

item.title: Releasing a new Open Source project
item.description: Here you can see the steps that describe how Saucers can release a new open source project.
